column1: International Project Management (Energy. Construction, Management, Oil and Gas) - MSc
column3: School of Engineering and Built Environment
column5: Develop the skills to manage international projects successfully. With growing global competition and increasingly complex regulatory structures, international project managers can make a major impact on an organisation's efficiency, and are in high demand.GCU's MSc International Project Management was designed by senior industry practitioners and leading academic experts. It is delivered by a teaching team experienced in delivering project management expertise spanning all five continents.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 12-16 months full-time, 2 years part-time, 2-5 months distance learning
